fields.description: I'm not quite sure about reproduction steps, but from time to time I try to invoke the 'External Diff' command through the context menu on a file and nothing happens.  I open the preferences to find that the Diff and Merge commands on the Diff tab are blank when I previously had them set.  So I have to navigate to the diff tool again.  I'm using Araxis and I do keep Sourcetree running when I sometimes do a Remote Desktop to my machine (I don't know if that has anything to do with it).
fields.summary: Sourcetree doesn't save the Diff and Merge command.

fields.description:
1. Launch SourceTree from Command Prompt, tab title is present.

2. Launch SourceTree from Git Bash , tab title is empty.

I attached short screencast presenting the problem in action. It is also available as [SourceTree 3.0.12: Launch from Git Bash with tab title missing|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ICFtpLnFjNE] on YouTube.
fields.summary: Launch from Git Bash command line with empty tab title

fields.description:
I'm running version 3.0.8 for Windows, and when I press Commit button, the "Checking submodules" dialog shows for half a second, and then nothing. No error message, and nothing has been commited. I can commit using the command line, however.

I previously "solved" this problem by uninstalling, deleting the userdata, and reinstalling (a simple reinstall was not sufficient).

But this is getting tedious. How can I get to the bottom of this?

Update: The log file says:

ERROR [2018-11-19 12:17:28,440] [49] [SourceTree.ViewModel.RepoDialogContainer] [Log] - The calling thread must be STA, because many UI components require this.

System.InvalidOperationException: The calling thread must be STA, because many UI components require this.

at System.Windows.Input.InputManager..ctor() at System.Windows.Input.InputManager.GetCurrentInputManagerImpl() at System.Windows.Input.KeyboardNavigation..ctor() at System.Windows.FrameworkElement.FrameworkServices..ctor() at System.Windows.FrameworkElement.EnsureFrameworkServices() at System.Windows.FrameworkElement..ctor() at System.Windows.Controls.Control..ctor() at SourceTree.View.Controls.DialogFileListControl..ctor(IEnumerable`1 items) at SourceTree.ViewModel.CommitAndFileStatusViewModel.CreateDisabledStagingViewCommitProcess(CommitOptions commitOptions, String useAuthor) at SourceTree.ViewModel.CommitAndFileStatusViewModel._FinaliseCommit() at SourceTree.ViewModel.CommitAndFileStatusViewModel.SubmoduleDialogCompleted(AbstractDialogViewModel repoDlg, Int32 returnCode) at SourceTree.ViewModel.AbstractDialogViewModel.Finish(Int32 returnCode) at SourceTree.ViewModel.SubmoduleCheckDialogViewModel.<RefreshSubmodules>d__46.MoveNext()
fields.summary: Sourcetree commit button does nothing

fields.description: Some user accounts get locked in active directory due to failed log-in attempts. This issue happens upon starting to pull from a remote repository. Login via web access to our Bitbucket server does not fail. Initial login via sourcetree to clone a repository does not fail either.
fields.summary: Failed login when pulling a branch

fields.description:
I am able to authenticate perfectly with OToken amd Basic authentication in my Bitbucket account but when I try to pull, authentication window opens and whatever I am giving my username and password in it, it says invalid username or password. (*remote: Invalid username or password*)
And I can able to login Bit bucket in chrome perfectly but not in the Remote.
fields.summary: Invalid User and Password while Pushing or Pulling

fields.description: My laptop crashed - BSOD. After it restarted, I haven't been able to commit my file.
fields.summary: Source Tree crash

fields.description:
Update (to 3.0.12) notification pops up --> click on Update --> Downloading --> Error:

The remote server returned an error: (404) Not Found.

 

(can't attach screenshot because of an old bug you have!)
fields.summary: Can't update as normal user

fields.description:
Whenever a push is attempted the user is asked to sign in only for even a correct password causing it to fail and end. Error is below

 

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --set-upstream origin master:master
Logon failed, use ctrl+c to cancel basic credential prompt.
remote: Invalid username or password
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://user@bitbucket.org/user/repo.git/'

Pushing to https://user@bitbucket.org/user/repo.git/
Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Unable to push changes due to sign in error in Source Tree
Sourcetree can not finish feature with git flow

fields.description: Pretty much everything is in the title: If Sourcetree is left in background for too long, the current repository tab will dissapear / be closed automatically, resulting in an empty window. The down arrow open an empty menu, and the [+] button let you open a fresh new tab.
fields.summary: Current repository tab closes itself if sourcetree is left in background for too long

fields.description:
I have started to use a "dynamic" {{.gitconfig}}, which means that I have moved a part of {{.gitconfig}} file into a separate file(s) and included it from the main {{.gitconfig}}. A particular file is included depending on repository's path.

The reason for that is that I'm sharing single machine for both my personal and work repositories and for each group I need to use a different user (name and e-mail). Before, I had global configuration for my personal repositories in {{.gitconfig}} and I had to set the proper user in every work repository's {{.git/config}} manually. It's not surprising I forgot many times and noticed it after it was pushed already and I cannot change it anymore.

So I have created a {{simple}} system

My {{~/.gitconfig}}:
{code:java}
[user]
  name = Personal User
  user = personal@user.com
[includeIf "gitdir/i:c:/work-repos/"]
  path = ~/.gitconfig-work
{code}
Included {{~/.gitconfig-work}}:
{code:java}
[user]
  name = Work User
  email = work@user.com
{code}
This way, repositories under the directory {{c:\work-repos}} (at any level) are using the _Work User_ from the config {{~/.gitconfig~}} while all other repositories located anywhere else are using the _Personal User_ from the main {{./gitconfig}}. I don't have to care about that anymore.

*Now, ServiceTree:* it seems to be working in ServiceTree (commits have the right owner), there's just one small glitch - when I open the repository _Settings_, tab _Advanced_, _User information_ is always showing the _Personal User_ on a repository under {{c:\work-repos}} when _Use global user settings_ is checked out even though it should be showing the _Work User_.

When I open _Terminal_ from SourceTree and execute {{git config --get user.email}}, it properly prints the {{Work User}}.
fields.summary: Wrong user in repo setting when using dynamic gitconfig

fields.description:
The sourcetree was working well last week to all members of my team. From today we have two problems:
 * When we pull it doesn't show us the pending changes to download and I know that there are
 * We can not push because it gives an error (Attach a file with the detail of the log)

 

We've updated both the sourcetree and mercurial versions and we're still the same.

!image-2018-12-03-16-35-10-134.png!
fields.summary: Unable to Pull or Push any changes in sourcetree since 1st Dec

fields.description:
I am able to authenticate correctly with OToken or Basic authentication to my Bitbucket account but I can't Refresh Remote Status and when I try to pull, it says "logon failed".
The authentication window opens and whatever I am putting in it, it says invalid username or password.
I tried changing my password, so I'm sure I'm putting the right credentials.
fields.summary: Authentication OK but logon failed on pulling

fields.description:
Not able to check-in and check-out in source using my credentials, Could you fix this issue ASAP.

Login Details:

 User Name: infinire

Email Id : [amzath.khan@infinire.com|mailto:amzath.khan@infinire.com]
fields.summary: My Account is not login in source tree
misc-content.css will crash source tree

fields.description:
Source Tree was working perfectly last week (last Friday), but when I came in to work this morning, it had stopped connecting to our mercurial repo..

When clicking pull changes, Source Tree is continually saying there are no changes to pull (even though I can see new commits on the Bitbucket web UI). No errors are reported, it just says 'No changes to pull'.  (see attached)

If I commit a change, and then try to push, the commit happens locally with no issues. But when pushing the change the change up to Bitbucket, Source Tree says "No Changes to push", even though it has a '1' on the 'Push' button indicating there is a local change to push.

 

We have tried using the embedded Mercurial version (v4.6.2)  and also have tried using the latest system version of Mercurial (v4.8) and the same thing happens with both versions.

 

Our entire dev team has had to resort to using different tools (tortoise hg) to continue working.

 

Please can you resolve this as soon as possible, as our testers are not familiar with other tools, and will be a big learning curve for them to have to learn something else.
fields.summary: Unable to Pull (or Push) any changes from mercurial repo on Bitbucket since 1st Dec.

fields.description:
I installed this version today and it won't even start.  From the download page it gives no indication this is a beta release. Here is the log I'm getting: [http://prntscr.com/lpe1ep] 

 

I've looked around online for issues and solutions and tried a bunch of stuff and nothing I've tried has worked. 

 

Please also note in your help section, the download it references is a broken link: http://prntscr.com/lpe0k8
fields.summary: Won't start

fields.description:
After a fresh start, external diff (CTRL-D) is not working.

You first have to enter the options screen and confirm that for it to work.

This needs to be done after every restart.

Using P4merge as diff tool.
fields.summary: External diff only working after confirming options screen

fields.description:
This feature really annoys me. I always push my latest work. We have some complicated pre-push hooks to verify integrity and I always check everything is OK before pushing and ultimately creating a pull request. Going through everything just to open a page in browser is annoying.

 

Being able to open the "create pull request" page in browser without anything else would be great.
fields.summary: Allow "Create pull request" without pushing

fields.description:
We have run into several issues when trying to search for remote repositories to clone from within Sourcetree. The server is GitLab CE hosted on premise.
 * Archived projects are shown in the search results. Marking a project as archived in GitLab will hide it from most views, and we expect the same to be true when searching from within Sourcetree.
 * Forks are not handled well. Often only one of many forks appear when searching, but I expect all forks that I have access to to be returned in the search result.
 * Some users have reported not receiving hits for repositories they have access to. They can search for some repos, but others does not appear. Manually getting the https: link from GitLab and cloning that from within Sourcetree works, so it is not a permission issue.
fields.summary: Issues searching for projects on GitLab CE

fields.description:
The following option setting is not persistent:

Options -> General -> Allow SourceTree to modify your global Git and Mercurial config files

After unchecking this option, the checkbox remains unchecked for as long as the app is running. When the application is exited and restarted, however, the option is always reset to its checked state.
fields.summary: Option is not saved: "Allow SourceTree to modify your global Git and Mercurial config files"

fields.description:
The dialog to add or edit a custom action (Tools -> Custom Actions -> Add / Edit) is not rendered nicely. The right and bottom side have a thick black border.

Also even when "Add" has been clicked, the dialog is always titled "*Edit* Custom Action".
fields.summary: "Custom Action" dialog has a glitchy black border

fields.description: When I go to add a new account in SourceTree, it brings up the Edit dialog (see attached). I should be seeing an Add dialog, no?
fields.summary: Adding an account brings up Edit dialog

fields.description:
Thanks for giving us source tree. It has a nice an clean interface and I like to use it. One tiny think could make it even better tough :)

 

Could you please allow me to select a portion of text in the file differences view so I can use it in my commit text? It would allow me to type less and get the exact spelling and casing of changed component names etc.

 

Thanks a lot of listening.

 

Regards,

 

Rob de Bruin.
fields.summary: Allow selection of a portion of text from the differences panel

fields.description: For people that have many repository the visual-assist of avatars on the tabs is a pretty nice QoL thing to have.
fields.summary: Add support for repository-specific avatars (.ico?) which -if employed- will be displayed on the left hand side of the text of each tab
error for sourcetree 3.0.8 with win10-1803
Discard Hunk does not honour line-endings

fields.description:
Start SourceTree, go to the Options - Diff

External Diff Tool = TortoiseMerge

Diff Command = _URI to Portable Tortoise Merge_

Arguments:  -base:\"$BASE\" -mine:\"$LOCAL\" -theirs:\"$REMOTE\" -merged:\"$MERGED\"

OK - restart SourceTree - the arguments line is lost and reset to \"$LOCAL\" \"$REMOTE\"
fields.summary: Options: Diff command arguments are not saved properly

fields.description:
Reproduction steps:
 # Go the the "File Status" tab
 # Select "All files" from the dropdown
 # Use the text filter box to find a particular file
 # Right click on the file and select "Log Selected". This works fine.
 # Use the text filter to find a different file
 # Right click on the file and notice that "Log Selected" is disabled

The only workaround is to empty the text filter and then type the new filter.
fields.summary: "Log Selected" command not available after changing file filter

fields.description:
Sourcetree is unable and unwilling to find my git installation. Please see the attached video.

 Sourcetree will not allow me to find my existing install, nor will it correctly install it's embedded copy. This issue persists through a reinstall.
fields.summary: Git install not located

fields.description:
Hello,

 

Just to let you know that if I clone a repo to my windows 10 machine, then drop files into that folder, sourcee tree become stuck. The source tree windows shows at the bottom of my screen in the windows 10 toolbar but when you click on it, nothing happens apart from the typical windows 10 locked windows sound.

 

I uninstalled it already 3 times, same issue each time. I think your latest version is causing some problems on Windows 10 1809

 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Source Tree windows stuck in bottom windows 10 bar

fields.description: Try to install SourceTree, get to the Registration page, where you have to choose Bitbucket Server or Bitbucket, so Choose BitBucket, then opens web browser, which seems to have a valid url, then redirects to a localhost address and port, so can never enter registration information, thus cannot install SourceTree.
fields.summary: Installation - Registration, takes me to localhost: site, so can never install.

fields.description:
Greetings,

I have set up in Tools -> Options -> Diff -> External Diff tool: P4Merge, after this when I press Ctrl + D the tool is launched correctly. However on next SourceTree launch, this doesn't work any longer. I need to set the ext diff tool again, then it works. 

 

Thanks
fields.summary: External diff tool option not persisted

fields.description:
The login popup continuously pop up even though I enter username password.

I also use the same account on other VM. Interestingly, I can just ignore the login (cancel) and it works just fine (I can push). Pycharm also works fine without continuously asking for login.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Login continuously poping up

fields.description:
When I double click in the sidebar to switch branch, it pops up the confirmation dialog and then proceeds to switch branch as expected. However, nothing changes visually - the sidebar still shows me as being on the original branch, as does the graph view.

If I then press F5 to refresh, the correct situation appears: the sidebar changes to show the current branch in bold, and the graph view shows the correct previous commit on the expected branch.

However, if I then click the Pull button, the 'remote branch to pull' dropdown shows the previous branch by default, and I need to manually switch it to my current branch to get the previously-default behaviour.

Similarly - though I haven't verified this - I believe that a similar problem happens when I right-click a branch and select 'Merge Master into current branch' - it appears (at least once) to have pulled the wrong branch and caused a different merge to what I had expected.
fields.summary: Switching branch is not reflected in sidebar, nor in pull dialog going forward

fields.description:
First time I'm adding bug here but this time it gone too far.

I left SourceTree running at about 11 P.M. and woke up about 9 A.M. Windows has been almost completly frozen. I'm attatching screenshots I've made before closing all credentials manager (BitBucket).

I understand that maybe some login/passwords are outdated (too many accounts/too many repositories), but logging should NEVER work in endless loop.

Yes, I tried refreshing credentials many times, clearing them all in options and re-entering again. Didn't work. Probably I would have to remove all repositories and add them again, one by one.

How it should work? Obviously popping up logging window is unacceptable, especially for repositories I don't care (working/not used for many months), so he can try to get info like he do now, but if something go wrong, there should be some "connection error" icon. That's all. Only repositories I try to connect/check (foreground) should have logging window popping up if necessary.
fields.summary: GiT Credential Manager total disaster/"memory leak"

fields.description:
!image-2018-11-22-17-35-34-093.png!!image-2018-11-22-17-33-25-101.png!

downloading succeeded but extracting failed.
fields.summary: Could not update embedded Git

fields.description: Totally randomly.
fields.summary: Stage hunk causing the file be deleted

fields.description:
It would really be amazing to add support for WSL git. All of my current dev env is running through WSL, so not having access to WSL git makes development very difficult (pre-commit hooks require WSL env to run successfully).

This is echoing the sentiment of SRCTREEWIN-6149

I tried using [gitwrap | https://github.com/ardevd/gitwrap] but that failed.
fields.summary: Add support for WSL git on Windows

fields.description:
When I click on log selected and Open selected version the file opens up in the default windows app.

This is a huge problem since when I am working on html files it opens up in browser instead of my editor.

There is not any selection to set custom actions in Log selected.

That missing feature makes sourcetree completely useless for viewing a file history
fields.summary: SourceTree Log selected does not have custom actions

fields.description:
SourceTree windows UI is not legible if windows desktop settings are set to use dark window background color with light colored font. Seems like some elements in UI were set to use system colors and others are fixed color, can the UI background, foreground and font colors be set to use windows system colors or all of them be fixed so that UI is legible in all cases?.

Attached screenshots should illustrate the issue.

fields.description: Would you please add a theme with dark colors? Working with the text based interface with a white background is not easy. A theme with dark colors, would make the interface much easier on the eyes.
fields.summary: Dark colored theme

fields.description: Would you please add a theme with dark colors? Working with the text based interface with a white background is not easy. A theme with dark colors, would make the interface much easier on the eyes.
fields.summary: Dark colored theme

fields.description:
I open SourceTree and it appears normal.  If I then switch to another window, doesn't have to be related to source code or development, could be just a word document.  If I try and Alt+Tab back to source tree it simply will not focus.  I get the windows default sound but can never see the window.  I can hover over the task bar and it will show the window but I can not access source tree.  If I click on the task bar I get the same thing, the windows sound, no window.  Task Manager shows SourceTree as responsive with little to no CPU or memory usage.  I simply cannot get the app to appear.

 

My only option is to right click on the task bar icon and click Close Window.  Re-open source tree for it to happen again shortly after.
fields.summary: SourceTree Unresponsive on Windows

fields.description:
My repo used to have its origin remote under a HTTP url. We had to change to use SSH and configured things so that almost everything works: SSH key has *no passphrase*, the server (TFS) has my public key configured, every command line works (BASH, PowerShell, Git-BASH, etc - even the BASH Terminal launched from Sourcetree works fine, doing fetches without prompting for credentials).

The only thing that isn't correct is that Sourcetree keeps popping up *Authenticate* dialogs asking for user name and password for my server (e.g. "_Login required for: my-tfs-server.my-company.com_"). If I cancel it the error displayed in Sourcetree is "_Error reading SSH_ASKPASS output for prompt: login as:_"
fields.summary: GUI Prompts for credentials even using SSH

fields.description:
Every time  minimize the window I cannot bring it back.

When I try - it produces a sound of an error and the window stays minimized.

The only workaround is to restart the application.

This behavior is fully consistent.
fields.summary: The window cannot be restored after minimize

fields.description: With Sourcetree open, Atlassian login pop up keeps coming up over and over. If left over the weekend, the pop up will occur so many times the PC runs out of resources. See pictures.
fields.summary: Sourcetree Atlassian login pop up over and over locking PC up

fields.description:
I am currently running Sourcetree 3.0.9-beta-2351. Sourcetree notifies that an update is available:

!image-2018-11-19-10-36-57-434.png!

 

When the update is then triggered, it fails to install:

 

!image-2018-11-19-10-37-22-401.png!
fields.summary: Error during the update process - method BZip2Stream..ctor() not found

fields.description: The scroll doesent work for laptops touchhpad. It doesent scroll up nor down in any section: history, file change section, comment section.
fields.summary: Scrolling doesent work on laptops touchpad.

fields.description:
When stash contains more than 20 files with multiple changed lines

it not always can show the stash preview tab

for me ts is very frustrating, I want to have at least summary of those changes.
fields.summary: Stash loading is too slow

fields.description:
When I'm trying to find all .sql files changed in last 10 days,

The program can not interpret my regex expression "*.sql"

In order to find all sql files changed.
fields.summary: Search tab - searching in file changes does not allow regex expression.

fields.description: Sometimes when sourcetree window is behind other windows when clicking on its icon in the taskbar it wont show up infront. After multiple fast clicks on its icon it eventuallty shows up. This started happening in the latest version - 3.0.8
fields.summary: Sometimes sourcetree not showing in the foreground on click

fields.description:
Please sort the tags naturally in Sourcetree display.

Instead of:
1.9.1
1.9.10
1.9.11
1.9.2

please sort it like
1.9.1
1.9.2
1.9.10
1.9.11
fields.summary: Sort git tags naturally

fields.description:
When I clic to create a Pull request from sourcetree it's make a bad link.
eg: [https://bitbucket.org//webengineeringfr/...]

The link containt a double shash after the Bitbucket domain.
fields.summary: Link to PR corrupt

fields.description:
Very often when I try to access the "Rebase children ___ interactively" in the context menu for commits, the option is grayed out for no reason. Simply navigating to a different branch and back makes the option come back. Here's a GIF illustrating the behavior:

!image-2018-11-15-19-33-51-721.png!

 

I'm not in the middle of an existing rebase. I'm not in a locked state. There should be no reason for this option to be grayed out.

 

This only happens on SourceTree 3.0.8 for Windows. I've never run into this on the Mac version.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase options grayed out sometimes

fields.description: It seems that everything that would be hidden behind the "Load More" button is not searchable.
fields.summary: Searching remote repositories not working
Source code file changes beyond 1400 lines are not shown

fields.description:
On version *3.0.8* P4Merge Diff Tool doesn't start.
 # Open Source Tree.
 # Click on any commit.
 # Click on any text file changed in the commit.
 # Ctrl+D

*Expected result:*
 P4Merge is started and file changes are presented.

*Actual result:*
 Nothing happens.

 

HOWEVER when I open Tools/Options/Diff and click OK *without making any changes, Ctrl+D works fine* until next SourceTree restart.
UPDATE: I don't have to open Diff tab. Clicking Tools/Options/OK also "activates" P4Merge.

Below my Diff settings:

 

!image-2018-11-14-20-47-12-568.png!
fields.summary: External Diff Tool - P4Merge starts only with dummy save-options action

fields.description:
SQL comments that have been removed that begin with -- do not show up when viewing the line diff in the SourceTree UI. 

The -- needs to be at the beginning of the line to reproduce this problem.  If there's any white space in front then the diff works as expected.

 

 

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a SQL file that has some -- comments in it and commit it

2. Modify the file to remove a comment

3. SourceTree shows the file as modified but does not show the line as having been removed

 

 

If you use the terminal and do a git diff, then the changes will appear.
fields.summary: Deleted SQL Comments are not showing in the diff
Application Window can not be restored if it has been mininized

fields.description:
I was using 2.x.  The software tells me there is an update for 3.0.8 in the top right orange flag menu.  Instead of closing the programming and attempting to update, it showed the sourcetree logo and then did nothing.

I tried to close and open it, then it showed me it was the new version.

Then it stopped working and hanged a few minutes later, when I wasn't even using it yet.

Then it refused to work at all after opening it again.

I redownloaded sourcetree 3.0.8 from the home page, and installed it.   Sourcetree was able to open again.

I think you should assume that at least the built-in updater has a bug that allows it to do a corrupted installation on top of the running process by mistake.  Or possibly that sourcetree 3.0.8 is able to hang and stop working, though I need more time using it to know if that is true.
fields.summary: Updating to Sourcetree 3.0.8 from within sourcetree 2.x caused a corrupted installation that hangs and wasn't able to start again
i can't create a new Feature

fields.description:
Hi there,

 

I am trying to clone a repostiory from GitHub.

 

Here is the repository:  [https://github.bedbath.com/BBBYOrg/bbbAssets]

 

When I open sourcetree and add this to the Source URL in the Clone tab and attempt to clone to my local machine, it gives me an error of "This is not a valid source path/URL".  When I click the error details, a box opens with this content:

 

Command: perl.exe C:\Users\na0145\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.0.8\tools\svn.pl info https://github.bedbath.com/BBBYOrg/bbbAssets
Output: 
Error: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: The system cannot find the file specified

Command: hg identify extensions.hgext.hgsubversion=! https://github.bedbath.com/BBBYOrg/bbbAssets
Output: 
Error: abort: HTTP Error 406: Not Acceptable

Command: git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks -c credential.helper= -c credential.helper="C:/Users/na0145/AppData/Local/ATLASS~1/SOURCE~1/GIT_EX~1/GIT-CR~1.EXE" ls-remote https://github.bedbath.com/BBBYOrg/bbbAssets
Output: 
Error: remote: Invalid username or password.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://github.bedbath.com/BBBYOrg/bbbAssets/'

 

 

 

I have tried resetting my Atlassian password and haven't been successful in cloning this repository.  


Any help would be appreciated!
fields.summary: When trying to clone a repository, getting an error message of "Not a valid source path"
Commit Comment Cursor is Missing

fields.description:
I upgraded from Sourcetree 2.5.x (or something like that, I'm not sure which version I had actually installed before) to version 3.0.8.

Now I'm no more able to compare more than one file at a time with Ctrl+D

I'm using Beyond compare Version 4.2.2 (build 22384) and I configured External Diff / Merge like this with Tool-Options, tab Diff: 

External Diff / Merge:

  Diff command : C:\Program Files\Beyond Compare 4\BCompare.exe

  Arguments: \"$LOCAL\" \"$REMOTE\"

 Steps to reproduce:
 * Select one file in the "Unstaged files" pane
 * Ctrl+D
 * Beyond Compare shows the comparision as expected
 * Back in sourctree select another file in the "Unstaged files" pane
 * Ctrl+D
 * Now Beyond Compare shows another TAB as expected, but apparently the left file could not be opened (the one in the temp directory with a name like _C:\Users\Michael\AppData\Local\Temp\9lspNa_MyFile.cpp) ._

Selecting more than one one file in Sourcetree and then pressing Ctrl+D doesn't work either, the symptoms are the same as explained above.

This used to work in all previous version s I've used.
fields.summary: Ctrl+D is not working on multiple files

fields.description:
I set "Check default remotes for updates every 5 minutes" but it checks nothing!

 

!SRCTREEWIN-10865 - Check default remotes for updates every 5 minutes doesn't work.gif|width=961,height=547!
fields.summary: "Check default remotes for updates every x minutes" doesn't work

fields.description:
With SourceTree version 3.0.8, the external diff tool works only for the first selected file. All additional files display a "file not found" error message. SourceTree shows the differences correctly. We are using BeyondCompare version 4.2.8. Earlier SourceTree versions worked fine.

Example to reproduce:
 * select a commit with several changed files
 * in the "Log/History" tab select one file (A) and show the differences in BeyondCompare (ctrl D in our case) --> the differences are shown in BeyondCompare as expected
 * in SourceTree select another file (B) and show the differences --> BeyondCompare shows "file not found" for both sides; the same effect is for all additional files as long as the BeyondCompare is open.
 * close BeyondCompare
 * in SourceTree select file B and show differences --> BeyondCompare OK
 * in SourceTree select file A and show differences --> BeyondCompare "file not found"
fields.summary: File not found with external diff tool (BeyondCompare)
in-app update does not update the version in Windows Program and Feature list

fields.description: I can no longer restore SourceTree (3.0.8.2279) window after it was minimized. The only workaround is to Close it and start SourceTree anew.
fields.summary: Cannot restore minimized SourceTree

fields.description:
When SourceTree window gets into background (when another program is started and comes on top of it or when SourceTree is minimized) and I click it on my task bar I just hear a blocking sound and SourceTree does not come up.

!image-2018-11-09-13-58-56-979.png!

A workaround is either to close + re-open SourceTree or to click very often on it in the task bar, after a time it comes up again.
fields.summary: SourceTree not coming to front again

fields.description: {color:#172b4d}When I open Sourcetree all nigth, In next day, I can get more than 50 login windows. The attach file is only 5 min. {color}
fields.summary: Many Login Windows

fields.description: It happens always I select a .css file. After that, it try to load the preview of the code. After that, there is no way back, it crashes and I have to force closure of SourceTree.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes if you select a .css (while loading preview of that file)

fields.description:
Window restoration is slow.
 If you try to open it again by storing it in the task bar, you can not open it.
 There is no choice but to restart sourcetree.
fields.summary: Window restoration is slow on taskbar.

fields.description:
One of our customers reported an error:
{panel}
There is a problem with the setup of the new version of SourceTree 3.0.8.
In the last screen the preferences are requested. 
It is not possible to click "Weiter" (Continue) without checking the second option.
 !Preferences.png|thumbnail! 
But this needs to be unchecked because of our company policy that does not allow to send user statistics to a vendor.
{panel}
fields.summary: Setup only possible with sending user statistics

fields.description:
See also SRCTREE-6139 (where this was originally misreported as a Mac issue).

As originally reported by Attila Tamas Zimler :

"The private remote SSH access is not expected to have remote details beside the origin path, so the optional extended integration is not configured. However, because no configuration for it, the Red exclamation mark does not disappear. Which in turn, is irritating."

The problem with this UX is that it is giving the false impression that something is wrong that the user needs to correct, and obviously there is nothing to correct.
fields.summary: Source tree remote settings are displaying a red exclamation mark - for private SSH remote access

fields.description:
Window refuses to return to max/normal state when it's minimized. The only way to restore it is through Task Manager -> Processes -> *Switch to*

This should get some priority since every time i minimize the window i need to use the task manager to re-open it. Or the most of the times i'm lazy to do so, so I killing it and re-open it.
fields.summary: Window refuses to return to max/normal state when it's minimized.

fields.description:
As of 3.0.8, something has changed which means that "Repository > Commit All" no longer stages all changes.

I work in staging mode all the time, but about half the time I just want to stage all my changes and commit rather than picking individual changes. Previously, I'd just press Shift+Ctrl+C to do that (Commit All) and it would Stage All and flip to the file changes with commit box focussed, which is exactly what I wanted.

I'm not sure which precise update stopped this happening but for me it was 3.0.8, and I noticed immediately. Commit All now does nothing at all in staging mode.

It may be that you're thinking Commit All should only do something in non-staging mode. However it's *extremely* useful to be able to commit everything in one go sometimes even if you do also want staging support. And keyboard shortcuts are key to productivity.

I have actually fixed this behaviour myself before, a couple of years ago ;)

If you don't agree, then Commit All should be disabled in staging mode, since Commit Staged (Shift+Alt+C, which I also use when partially committing) works instead. Perhaps Commit All should become Stage All (there is no separate feature for this) instead. Otherwise there is no fast way any more to stage & commit everything from the keyboard, and that makes me sad. :(
fields.summary: Commit All (Shift+Ctrl+C) no longer stages all

fields.description: My organization is heavily into microservice development.  As such, we have many repositories for our projects.  It would be a great addition to the UI to have the ability to open and close related repository tabs through a single click.
fields.summary: Repository Tab Groups Or Mechanism to Open Related Tabs Quickly

fields.description:
I once had a repository on Github.

Currently I only use repositories on a Gitlab Server. I removed all saved password entries related to Github and all bookmarks I currently have are on Gitlab.

Nevertheless SourceTree from time to time opens a Login request for Github. When I'm at my PC that's fine I can close it. But sometimes I let my PC running and do other stuff.

I now came back and found my PC at 100% CPU with thousends of Github Login windows flooding my Desktop, CPU and GPU. Even after closing them all one by one SourceTree after a couple of minutes immedtiately fired 25 new Login consoles.

 

The only way out was a reboot of the PC. However after rebooting and starting SourceTree again it opens 2 Github Logins like every 5-10 Minutes no matter if I provide my correct credentials or not.
fields.summary: Sourcetree floods my PC with Github Login requests

fields.description:
I removed all saved credentials and wanted to add a new account/credential for my Gitlab server via Tools-> Options -> Authentication -> Accounts -> Add

I choose

Hosting Service: Gitlab CE
 Host URL: https://<URL>
 Preferred Protocol: HTTPS

Authentication: Personal Access Token
 Username: <not available>

when I than click on Refresh Personal Access Token
 SourceTree asks for Username and Password

 

I 100% sure to provide my login data but it claimes
 Failed to ckeck login for user []
 User Details check failed

 

The result now is that not only I can not access my repositories using SourceTree *BUT* I get a *403 - Forbidden* page in *any browser* while the page is still available normal for other users. I tried to clear all caches, removed every entry for this server from the Windows Crendetial Manager and finally rebooted.

The issue still is here I can not reach my own server's page anymore from any browser on this PC!

 

 

*Update*

The issue was after a few attempts my IP was blocked by the gitlab server itself. I could solve this by removing the lock for my IP.

However the main issue still persists namely it is not possible to add a credential/ remote account for Gitlab manually.
fields.summary: SourceTree fucked up my credentials?

fields.description:
Open SourceTree (v3.0.8)

Use "Beyond Compare" (v.4.x) as external diff viewer.

Select multiple (2) modified files and call external diff (CTRL+D)
 Two tabs are opened in BC4 but only the first one shows the differences. In the second tab the remote file is missing.

 

Another Issue:

Configure a userdefined diff-viewer (e.g.  BComp,exe).
 Close Sourcetree and check common git settings for difftool.
 Restart Sourcetree 
      --> The difftool command in ".gitconfig" will be erased!!!
 Open the Options and close it with OK.
     --> The difftool command in ".gitconfig" will be restored!!
fields.summary: SourceTree opens the external diff tool incorrectly.

fields.description:
After updating Sourcetree Enterprise from 2.6.10 to 3.0.8 Sourcetree doesnt start anymore. The splash screen is shown, but then nothing happens.

The log in *C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\sourcetree.log* says:

{{2018-11-06T11:47:32: CompositionException [Errors occurred during discovery.]}}

I tried to deinstall sourcetree before installing by running:

{{$sourcetreeGUID = (Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_Product -ComputerName . -Filter "Name='Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0'").IdentifyingNumber}}{{Start-Process -Wait -FilePath C:\windows\system32\msiexec.exe -ArgumentList '/x', $sourcetreeGUID, '/qn'}}

But that doesn't fix the issue either.

After completely removing everything related to sourcetree and performing a new install, Sourcetree 3.0.8 does start. I think this is unwanted, because users lose their preferences.

This is the case for all 3.x versions so far and possible for versions 2.x as well.
fields.summary: SourcetreeEnterprise: CompositionException after updating from 2.6.10 to 3.0.8

fields.description:
On Windows 10, the latest version of Sourcetree cannot always be restored by clicking its entry on the taskbar.  The click appears to be simply ignored.

The workaround is to right-click the Souretree entry, close its window and then reopen the whole application.  Mysteriously, when I do this, it seems to have forgotten its previous window size and position and reverts to its defaults.
fields.summary: Latest Sourcetree cannot always be redisplayed by clicking its taskbar entry.
After minimizing, there may be cases where it cannot be displayed again.

fields.description:
Sourcetree is checking each repo for updates every 5 min (as I want it to), and I've got 7 repos open. All good so far.

My credentials expired (or were lost) sometime early last week. This is a desktop machine always on that I remote into, so it was running for the whole time. Every 5 minutes, it started a new process that got to the point of asking me for credentials, and then hung.

So now I've got thousands of processes all trying to open UI. And even closing all the windows causes them to start doing retries, not to give up. Sourcetree has DoSed my machine.

Sourcetree needs to, minimally, check to see whether prior fetches are still in progress before starting another one to the same server. And it should probably start all those processes at background priority, so that they don't steal the UI resources that would be needed to shut them down. That way, even when an unexpected situation arises, you won't totally DoS the machine.
fields.summary: Sourcetree denial of service to host machine - consuming all computer resources

fields.description:
1) Go to options > Difference 

2) Select as external software "beyound compare",

its command textbox is correctly filled

3) Save and Close ST

4) Reopen ST, Go to options > Difference , et voilà

command textbox is empty!
fields.summary: Difference / Merge software lost settings

fields.description:
Tab Log / History:

Select an empty commit and you will see the file changes of the selected commit before.
fields.summary: Log / History: Emtpy commits show (wrong) file changes

fields.description: Whenever an additional window is opened on SourceTree (such as 'log history' or even the pull details dialog) one cannot switch windows again into SourceTree. Clicking "SourceTree" on the task bar just beeps. Trying to switch to it using ALT-TAB does the same. As if there's some modal dialog that prevents opening the main window. In this scenario I have no way to continue working with SourceTree and have to close it and re-open.
fields.summary: Can't re-open SourceTree in Windows10

fields.description:
Upgraded from 2.6 to 3.0.8. Two new bugs which are annoying:

1) Checking out a branch is not reflected in the GUI, I have to press F5.

2) Deleting a newly added file inside "Unstaged Files" in the "File Status" tab is not reflected in the GUI, I have to press F5.

 

Also can you please fix this dinosaur aged bug:

a) In "Log/History" tab, clicking on a particular commit and file change, on the file change previews panel on the bottom right, copying a line is really slow. It seems like copying is "lazy loaded". Ctrl+C on any line (or multiple lines) is quick, then pasting somewhere else freezes source tree for 5-10 seconds, then finally pastes. If you paste and don't wait 5-10 seconds by going to another program, the paste fails and nothing happens.
fields.summary: Checked out branch and changed files are not refreshed

fields.description: My win10 OS crash once per day in last three months，sometimes twice one day. In fact, I am not sure that this is caused by the source tree. However, many crashes occurred when I browsed git with a pulley. Sorry, I don't have more information, but I want to know if anyone else is the same as me.
fields.summary: Win10 crash

fields.description:
Reproduce:

 
 # Open Source Tree
 # Click the minimize button on the top-right window
 # Click the source tree icon on windows task bar

The source tree window can never back

I can only close it and start it again.
fields.summary: Source Tree Window cannot back after it minimized.

fields.description: When you have pending files, and show them in a tree view, right-clicking on a folder and then 'show in Explorer' opens every child item beneath that node. Folders and files. It tries to create a new instance of the Explorer for every item, of course stressing the system to no extend. The only remedy when you have the bad fortune of clicking a folder with lots of subfolders and files, is forcing a restart for the system.
fields.summary: 'Show in Explorer' on folder recursively opens all child items, halting the system

fields.description:
I have stacked monitors (one above the other). Some dialog boxes appear between the two monitors rather than in the centre of one. The dialog box for "Replace commit text?" dialog (when appending a commit) has this issue but not all dialogs.

*Expected Result*

Dialog boxes should be centre of the current monitor on a two vertically stacked monitors

*Actual Result*

Dialog boxes is positioned 'centre' of the overall display space. on the top of my bottom monitor and the bottom of my top monitor.
fields.summary: Confirmation Screens appear in centre of screen

fields.description:
As soon as SourceTree is minimized, the window will no longer show up. If I hover over the taskbar icon, I can see the window thumbnail, and if I hover over the thumbnail the window shows in its full glory, however if I click on it it's gone.

The only way to bring it back up is to right click in the taskbar, close the application, and start it again.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not recover from minimized state

fields.description:
SourceTree fails to connect to Visual Studio Team Services when the new Azure DevOps URL is in use.

Using "*https://dev.azure.com/ACCOUNT*" fails with error "+Authentication failed+" when using "+Refresh Personal Access Token+".

Using "*https://ACCOUNT.visualstudio.com*" works fine. (this is the old domain, new accounts are not using this URL anymore)

Capturing packets using FIDDLER I noticed that when using "*https://dev.azure.com/ACCOUNT*" SourceTree tries to connect to "*app.vssps.visualstudio.com*" instead of the given URL.

When using " https://ACCOUNT.visualstudio.com", SourceTree connects properly to that URL.
fields.summary: Authentication fails when using Azure DevOps URL

fields.description:
Just an efficiency idea that would be fairly simple to implement.
Can you add a Pull All Tabs button, that would bring up the normal Pull popup and apply it to every open project-tab?  At work I have a LOT of project tabs open (22 today due to each project having multiple submodules).
fields.summary: Feature request:  Pull All Open Tabs

fields.description:
Does not open SourceTree again after close window tab

I'm working on SourceTree version 3.0.8
fields.summary: Does not open SourceTree again after close window tab !!!
